meanings.definition: The belief in the importance of a group of people leading the way in new developments or ideas.
meanings.sent1: In vanguardism, leaders guide others towards new ideas.
meanings.sent2: The vanguardism of the team propelled them to success.
meanings.sent3: The vanguardism of the penguins in choosing the best fishing spot was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her vanguardism in the classroom made her stand out like a bright light.
meanings.sent5: The vanguardism of the explorer inspired many to follow in his footsteps.

meanings.definition: The state of being at the forefront of a movement or trend.
meanings.sent1: Being in vanguardism means being ahead of the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The company's vanguardism in technology kept them ahead of competitors.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's vanguardism in gathering nuts was quite unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her vanguardism in fashion made her a trendsetter among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The vanguardism of the artist's work captured the attention of many.
